alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 4:40PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Winds to 45 mph, small hail and heavy rain will impact portions of Teton, southeastern Fremont, northeastern Bonneville and southeastern Madison Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 438 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Felt to near Alta to near Irwin. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 45 mph, accumulating half inch hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated and mesonet observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Driggs, Swan Valley, Felt, Palisades Reservoir, Victor, Tetonia, Irwin, Drummond, Tetonia Research Station, Pine Creek Pass and Alpine Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley
